TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit FormsService extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPService implements class Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.Backup.IBackupRestore, class Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.Backup.IBackupRestoreConfiguration
Public NotInheritable Class FormsService Inherits SPService Implements IBackupRestoreConfiguration
type FormsService = class inherit SPService interface IBackupRestoreConfiguration interface IBackupRestore

Docs.summary: Represents the top level entity of InfoPath Forms Services.

remarks.para: The object is an SharePoint Server 2010 shared service provider that extends the object. Like all shared service providers, it is load-balanced and runs at the farm level. There is only one instance of the forms service per farm.

example.para: The following code example writes the forms service status to the console that the forms service is not available. References are required in the Visual Studio project to the , the , and the assemblies.
Note: Browse for the assembly at [drive]:\Program Files\Microsoft Office Servers\14.0\Bin.
For the example to work, Import statements are required for the
example.code: Dim LocalFormsService As FormsService Try LocalFormsService = SPFarm.Local.Services.GetValue(Of FormsService)(FormsService.ServiceName) Console.WriteLine(LocalFormsService.Status.ToString()) Catch ex As Exception Console.WriteLine("The forms service is not provisioned.") End Try
example.para: For the example to work, using statements are required for the
example.code: FormsService localFormsService; try { localFormsService = SPFarm.Local.Services.GetValue<FormsService>(FormsService.ServiceName); Console.WriteLine(localFormsService.Status.ToString()); } Catch (Exception ex) { Console.WriteLine("The forms service is not provisioned."); }

The SharePoint farm where the forms service is located.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ActiveSessionsTimeout { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.ActiveSessionsTimeout : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the duration, in minutes, that a form session state can remain active.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: The default value for the is 1440 minutes. This property corresponds to the Active sessions should be terminated after setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.
Note: Increasing the value of this property could adversely affect server performance and increase the chance of Denial of Service attacks on the server.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowEmbeddedSqlForDataConnections { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowEmbeddedSqlForDataConnections : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether embedded SQL authentication can be used by browser-enabled form templates.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: When the property is false, connecting to a SQL database using a connection string with embedded SQL credentials will fail. When true, the SQL connection string is allowed. This property corresponds to the Allow embedded SQL authentication setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowUdcAuthenticationForDataConnections { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether authentication information in a Universal Data Connection (UDC) file can be used.
Docs.value: true if authentication from the UDC file can be used in the data connection; false if it is ignored.

remarks.para: The is false by default, and corresponds to the Allow non-admin-deployed form templates to use authentication information contained in data connection files setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.

If a Universal Data Connection (UDC) file contains alternate authentication information, such as a username and password or a Single Sign-On (SSO) application ID, the property can be used to disable all forms on the server from using that information.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowUserFormBrowserEnabling { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowUserFormBrowserEnabling : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether users can browser-enable form templates that do not contain form code, require full trust, enable rendering on a mobile device, or use a data connection managed by a server administrator.
Docs.value: true if users can browser-enable form templates.

remarks.para: The is true by default, and corresponds to the Allow end users to browser-enable form templates setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the SharePoint Central Administration site.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowUserFormBrowserRendering { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowUserFormBrowserRendering : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether browser-enabled form templates will be rendered by InfoPath Forms Services.
Docs.value: true if forms services renders browser-enabled form templates; false if rendering is disabled.

remarks.para: The is true by default, and corresponds to the Render form templates that were browser-enabled by end users setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the SharePoint Central Administration site.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowUserFormCrossDomainDataConnections { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether data connections to data sources located in a different domain can be queried.
Docs.value: true if cross-domain data connections are allowed.

remarks.para: The default value of the property is false. A form template with a Domain security level cannot use a data connection if the data source is in another domain, even if the data connection information is stored in a trusted Universal Data Connection (UDC) file.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AllowUserFormWebServiceProxy (Uri webApplicationUri, bool enable);
.method public hidebysig instance void AllowUserFormWebServiceProxy(class System.Uri webApplicationUri, bool enable) cil managed
Public Sub AllowUserFormWebServiceProxy (webApplicationUri As Uri, enable As Boolean)
public: void AllowUserFormWebServiceProxy(Uri ^ webApplicationUri, bool enable);

Docs.param: The Uniform Resource Indicator (URI) of the SharePoint Web application associated with the Web service proxy, and located between the farm, but above the site collection level. For more information, see SPWebApplication.
The boolean value which enables or disables the use of the proxy.
Docs.summary: Controls whether a form opened in the InfoPath client can use the InfoPath Forms Services Web service proxy to connect to a Web service.

remarks.para: Use the method to allow browser-enabled form templates to use the proxy service. Default setting is false.

The boolean value which enables or disables the use of the proxy.
Docs.summary: Controls whether browser-enabled form templates can use the InfoPath Forms Services Web service proxy to connect to a Web service.

remarks.para: Use the method to allow InfoPath clients to use the proxy service. Default setting is false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.Server.Administration.ConverterMessageCollection BrowserEnableUserFormTemplate(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFile solutionFile) cil managed
Public Function BrowserEnableUserFormTemplate (solutionFile As SPFile) As ConverterMessageCollection

Docs.param: The form template file (.xsn) file to browser-enable.
Docs.summary: Browser-enables a browser-compatible form template that does not contain form code, require full trust, enable rendering on a mobile device, or use a data connection managed by a server administrator.
Docs.returns: Returns a collection of messages that describe the results of the form template conversion.

remarks.para: A manifest (.xsf) file of a browser-compatible form template can be used in the parameter if all supporting files are located in the same folder. For form templates that contain code, use the methods of the collection and the object.

example.para: In the following code example, a file that has been uploaded to a form library is browser-enabled.
example.code: Dim LocalFormsService As FormsService Dim LocalFarm As SPFarm = SPFarm.Local Dim LocalSite As SPSite = New SPSite("http://ServerName") Dim LocalWeb As SPWeb = LocalSite.AllWebs("SiteName") Dim LocalFile As SPFile Try LocalFormsService = LocalFarm.Services.GetValue(Of FormsService)(FormsService.ServiceName) LocalFile = LocalWeb.GetFile("FormLibrary/Forms/FormTemplate.xsn ") LocalFormsService.BrowserEnableUserFormTemplate(LocalFile) Console.Write("Press Enter to Continue") Console.ReadLine() Catch ex As Exception Console.WriteLine("Error: " + ex.Message) Console.Write("Press Enter to Continue") Console.ReadLine() End Try

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DataConnectionFiles As DataConnectionFileCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of Universal Data Connection (UDC) files available on the server farm.
Docs.value: A collection of UDC files.

remarks.para: Use the to access properties of the UDC files such as , , , , , , and the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int DefaultDataConnectionTimeout { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.DefaultDataConnectionTimeout : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the default data connection timeout in milliseconds.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: The default value for the is 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds). This property corresponds to the Default data connection timeout setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.
Note: Increasing the value of this property could adversely affect server performance.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ExemptUserAgents As ExemptUserAgentCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of objects
Docs.value: A collection.

remarks.para: User agents can be added to or removed from the collection using methods of the collection. Exempt user agents receive a content stream of InfoPath files from the server instead of an HTML representation of the InfoPath form.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FormTemplates As FormTemplateCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of all administrator approved, browser-enabled form templates deployed to the server farm.
Docs.value: A collection.

remarks.para: The collection represents all administrator approved form templates on the server farm. It does not include browser-enabled user form templates or form templates deployed to site collections as SharePoint content types.

example.para: The following code examples write the count of administrator approved form templates to the console.
example.code: Dim LocalFormsService As FormsService Dim LocalFarm As SPFarm Dim FormTemps As Integer Try LocalFarm = SPFarm.Local LocalFormsService = LocalFarm.Services.GetValue(Of FormsService)(FormsService.ServiceName) FormTemps = LocalFormsService.FormTemplates.Count() Console.WriteLine("Number of form templates: " & FormTemps.ToString()) Console.Write("Press Enter to Continue") Console.ReadLine() Catch ex As Exception Console.WriteLine("Error: " + ex.Message) Console.Write("Press Enter to Continue") Console.ReadLine() End Try

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxDataConnectionResponseSize { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxDataConnectionResponseSize : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size allowed for a data connection response.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: The default size of the is 1500 kilobytes. This property corresponds to the Data Connection Response Size setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.
Note: Increasing the value of this property could adversely affect server performance and increase the chance of Denial of Service (DOS) attacks on the server.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property long MaxDataConnectionRoundTrip { long get(); void set(long value); };
member this.MaxDataConnectionRoundTrip : int64 with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time allowed for a data connection to retrieve data.
Docs.value: The maximum amount of time allowed for a data connection to retrieve data.

remarks.para: If the time it takes for a data connection to retrieve data exceeds the property setting, a Unified Logging Service (ULS) entry is created. This setting is not available on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site. You can set the value of the property only by using code or the corresponding PowerShell cmdlet.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxDataConnectionTimeout { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxDataConnectionTimeout : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum data connection timeout in milliseconds.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: The default value for the is 20000 milliseconds (20 seconds). This setting overrides settings on data connections in individual form templates if they exceed the value for this property. This property corresponds to the Maximum data connection timeout setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.
Note: Increasing the value of this property could adversely affect server performance and increase the chance of Denial of Service (DOS) attacks on the server.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property long MaxFormLoadTime { long get(); void set(long value); };
member this.MaxFormLoadTime : int64 with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time allowed for a form to load on the server.
Docs.value: The maximum amount of time allowed for a form to load on the server.

remarks.para: The value set for the property does not include the time required to render the form in the browser. If the time it takes to load a form on the server exceeds the property setting, a Unified Logging Service (ULS) entry is created. This setting is not available on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site. You can set the value of the property only by using code or the corresponding PowerShell cmdlet.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxPostbacksPerSession { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxPostbacksPerSession : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the maximum postbacks an instance of a browser-enabled form template can make to the forms service.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: The default number of is 75. This property corresponds to the Number of postbacks per form session setting on the Thresholds section of the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.
Note: Increasing the value of this property could adversely affect server performance and increase the chance of Denial of Service (DOS) attacks on the server.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxSizeOfFormSessionState { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxSizeOfFormSessionState : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the maximum size of session state an instance of a browser-enabled form template can use.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: The default size of the is 4096 kilobytes (4 MB). This property corresponds to the Size of form session state setting on the Thresholds section of the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.
Note: Increasing the value of this property could adversely affect server performance and increase the chance of Denial of Service (DOS) attacks on the server.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxSizeOfUserFormState { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxSizeOfUserFormState : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the maximum size of user session data that an instance of a browser-enabled form template can use.
Docs.value: The maximum size of user session data that an instance of a browser-enabled form template can use.

remarks.para: The default size of the property is 4096 kilobytes (4 MB). This property corresponds to the Maximum size of user session data setting on the User Sessions section of the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.
Note: Increasing the value of this property could adversely affect server performance and increase the chance of Denial of Service (DOS) attacks on the server.

member this.MaxUserActionsPerPostback : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum user actions per postback.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: The default value for the is 200. This property corresponds to the Number of actions per postback setting on the Thresholds section of the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.
Note: Increasing the value of this property could adversely affect server performance and increase the chance of Denial of Service (DOS) attacks on the server.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MemoryCacheSize { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MemoryCacheSize : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of the memory cache used for the components of browser-enabled form templates.
Docs.value: The size of the memory cache used for the components of browser-enabled form templates.

remarks.para: The default size of the property is 300 MB. The data managed by this setting consists of items such as the .html, .css, and .js files that are used by form templates after they are converted (browser-enabled).

Docs.summary: Provisions the forms service on the SharePoint server farm.

remarks.para: This method should not be used from code. Corresponds to provisioning the InfoPath Forms Services through the SharePoint 2010 Products Configuration Wizard

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RequireSslForDataConnections { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RequireSslForDataConnections : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) requirement value.
Docs.value: true if SSL is required for data connections; false if not.

remarks.para: The default value of the is true. If the credential type contained in the Universal Data Connection (UDC) file is basic or digest, the connection will fail if is true and the connection URL does not begin with "https". If false, all connections will succeed regardless of the protocol.
This property corresponds to the Require SSL for HTTP authentication to data sources setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.

Docs.summary: The forms service identification.

remarks.para: This field can be used when referencing the forms service, however using the instead of the may make administration automation code easier to read and maintain.

Docs.summary: The forms service name.

remarks.para: The field is used when referencing the forms service, and may make administration automation code easier to read and maintain instead of using the .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ViewStateThreshold { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.ViewStateThreshold : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size, in kilobytes, of the session state when stored in the form view.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: The default size of the is 40 kilobytes. This property corresponds to the Form view (reduces database load on server). If form session state is larger than the specified value, the Session State Service will be used instead setting on the Configure InfoPath Forms Services page of the Central Administration site.
